meanings.definition: Something that encourages or motivates someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The promise of a reward can be a strong incentive to work harder.
meanings.sent2: Companies often offer bonuses as an incentive for employees to perform well.
meanings.sent3: The idea of winning a prize was a great incentive for the students to participate in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The prospect of a promotion served as a powerful incentive for him to excel in his job.
meanings.sent5: The thought of achieving his dream was the ultimate incentive for him to keep pushing forward.

meanings.definition: A payment or concession to stimulate greater output or investment.
meanings.sent1: The government provided tax incentives to encourage businesses to invest in renewable energy.
meanings.sent2: Offering discounts can be an effective incentive to attract more customers to a store.
meanings.sent3: The company's decision to offer free shipping was a clever incentive to boost online sales.
meanings.sent4: The special promotion was an irresistible incentive for customers to purchase the new product.
meanings.sent5: The bonus scheme served as a strong incentive for employees to increase their productivity.
